title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Corinthians chapter 8 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Corinthians Chapter 8.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:1, what does knowledge do?
options: Knowledge puffeth up
Knowledge humbles
Knowledge saves
Knowledge destroys
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge puffeth up
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:1 states that knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 8:2, what is said about a person who thinks he knows something?
options: He knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know
He has great wisdom
He is a teacher
He is enlightened
questions.correctAnswer: He knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:2 says that if any man think he knoweth anything, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:3, who is known of God?
options: He who loves God
He who prays often
He who gives offerings
He who teaches others
questions.correctAnswer: He who loves God
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:3 states that if any man loves God, the same is known of him.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8:4 say about idols?
options: An idol is nothing in the world
An idol is powerful
An idol is a god
An idol is a helper
questions.correctAnswer: An idol is nothing in the world
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:4 explains that an idol is nothing in the world, and there is none other God but one.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:5, what are there many of?
options: Gods and lords
Prophets and teachers
Saints and angels
Kings and priests
questions.correctAnswer: Gods and lords
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:5 states that there be gods many and lords many.

questions.question: Who is described as the one God to us in 1 Corinthians 8:6?
options: The Father
Zeus
Apollo
Baal
questions.correctAnswer: The Father
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:6 says to us there is but one God, the Father, of whom are all things.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:6, who is the one Lord?
options: Jesus Christ
Moses
David
Elijah
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:6 states there is one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8:7 say about the conscience of some people?
options: Their conscience is weak
Their conscience is strong
Their conscience is pure
Their conscience is enlightened
questions.correctAnswer: Their conscience is weak
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:7 mentions that some have a weak conscience regarding idols.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:8, what does eating meat do in relation to God?
options: Meat commendeth us not to God
Meat pleases God
Meat makes us holy
Meat is sinful
questions.correctAnswer: Meat commendeth us not to God
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:8 says meat commendeth us not to God, neither if we eat are we better, nor if we eat not are we worse.

questions.question: What warning is given in 1 Corinthians 8:9 about liberty?
options: Lest this liberty become a stumblingblock to the weak
Liberty is always good
Liberty means freedom from God
Liberty is not important
questions.correctAnswer: Lest this liberty become a stumblingblock to the weak
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:9 warns to take heed lest liberty become a stumblingblock to them that are weak.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 8:11 says that through knowledge, the weak brother may perish.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:11 states that through knowledge the weak brother shall perish, for whom Christ died.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 8:12, sinning against the weak brethren is sinning against Christ.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:12 says that when you wound a weak brother's conscience, you sin against Christ.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 8:13 says to eat no flesh if it causes a brother to offend.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:13 states that if meat makes a brother offend, the speaker will eat no flesh while the world standeth.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 8:1: 'Knowledge ______ up, but charity edifieth.'
options: puffeth
humbles
guides
saves
questions.correctAnswer: puffeth
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:1 says knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 8:4: '...we know that an idol is ______ in the world.'
options: nothing
everything
powerful
visible
questions.correctAnswer: nothing
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:4 states that an idol is nothing in the world.

medium.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 8 teach us about humility when it says, 'Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth'?
options: Knowledge makes us proud, but love builds others up
Knowledge is the most important spiritual gift
Love is unnecessary if you have knowledge
Charity means giving money only
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge makes us proud, but love builds others up
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:1 contrasts knowledge with charity, showing that knowledge can lead to pride, but love (charity) builds up the community. This teaches humility and prioritizing love over pride. See also verses 2, 3, and 12.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8, what does it mean if a person claims to know something but does not love God?
options: They actually know nothing as they ought to know
They are wiser than others
Their knowledge is complete
They are approved by God
questions.correctAnswer: They actually know nothing as they ought to know
questions.explanation: Verses 2 and 3 explain that claiming knowledge without love means one does not truly know as they should. True knowledge is connected with loving God and being known by Him.

questions.question: What biblical truth about God’s uniqueness can we learn from 1 Corinthians 8?
options: There is but one God, the Father, and one Lord Jesus Christ
There are many gods to worship
Idols have real power in the world
Jesus is one of many lords
questions.correctAnswer: There is but one God, the Father, and one Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verses 4-6 emphasize monotheism, affirming there is only one true God and one Lord Jesus Christ, while idols are nothing. This teaches exclusive faith and worship in God alone.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 8 instruct believers to act regarding food offered to idols when their conscience is weak?
options: Avoid eating it if it causes a weak brother to stumble
Eat freely because food cannot defile
Force others to eat as you do
Ignore others’ consciences
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid eating it if it causes a weak brother to stumble
questions.explanation: Verses 7-13 teach that though food itself is not defiling, believers must consider the conscience of others, avoiding actions that might cause weaker believers to sin or fall. Love and care for others’ spiritual wellbeing is emphasized.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 8, knowledge alone is sufficient to guide a believer’s actions without regard for others’ conscience.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 9 warns that knowledge and liberty must be exercised with caution so as not to become a stumblingblock to the weak. Love and consideration must guide actions, not knowledge alone.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8 say about the effect of one's actions on a weaker brother for whom Christ died?
options: Through knowledge, the weak brother can perish if led to sin
The weak brother is unaffected by others' actions
Knowledge protects all believers equally
The weak brother should be ignored
questions.correctAnswer: Through knowledge, the weak brother can perish if led to sin
questions.explanation: Verse 11 explains that causing a weaker brother to sin through one’s knowledgeable actions can lead to their spiritual ruin, highlighting the responsibility believers have for one another.

questions.question: Based on 1 Corinthians 8, what is the relationship between sinning against a brother and sinning against Christ?
options: Wounding a brother's weak conscience is sinning against Christ
They are unrelated
Sinning against a brother is less serious
Christ does not notice
questions.correctAnswer: Wounding a brother's weak conscience is sinning against Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 12 clearly states that when one sins against a brother by causing spiritual harm, it is also sinning against Christ, showing the unity of believers and Christ’s presence in the church community.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'If meat make my brother to _____, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth.'
options: offend
grow
prosper
laugh
questions.correctAnswer: offend
questions.explanation: Verse 13 teaches self-sacrifice and love by avoiding anything that would cause a brother to stumble or be offended, even if it means giving up personal liberty.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 8 describe the conscience of some believers regarding eating food offered to idols?
options: Some have a weak conscience and are defiled by eating it
All believers have the same strong conscience
Conscience does not matter in eating food
Everyone freely eats without concern
questions.correctAnswer: Some have a weak conscience and are defiled by eating it
questions.explanation: Verse 7 points out that not all believers have the same knowledge or conscience; some who see it as idol food have a weak conscience and are spiritually defiled by eating it.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8 say about the effect of eating or not eating meat on a believer’s relationship with God?
options: Eating meat neither makes us better nor worse before God
Eating meat makes us holier
Not eating meat makes us less spiritual
God prefers meat-eaters
questions.correctAnswer: Eating meat neither makes us better nor worse before God
questions.explanation: Verse 8 clarifies that food itself does not commend us to God; spiritual standing is not improved or harmed by eating or not eating meat.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 8, idols hold real power over physical things in heaven or on earth.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 4-6 explain that idols are nothing in the world and there is only one God. Though some are called gods, they have no true power, teaching believers to trust only in God.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with exercising their liberty because of others’ weak consciences. Based on 1 Corinthians 8, what advice would you offer?
options: Prioritize love and avoid actions that cause others to stumble
Assert your liberty regardless of others
Ignore the weak consciences around you
Focus only on your own knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: Prioritize love and avoid actions that cause others to stumble
questions.explanation: Verses 9-13 counsel believers to be mindful of how their freedom might become a stumblingblock, emphasizing love and care for the spiritual wellbeing of others over personal liberty.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 8 teach us about the importance of love in spiritual knowledge?
options: Love is essential and shows true knowledge
Knowledge alone is sufficient
Love should be avoided to gain knowledge
Spiritual gifts replace love
questions.correctAnswer: Love is essential and shows true knowledge
questions.explanation: Verses 1-3 emphasize that without love, knowledge is incomplete. Loving God and others is the mark of genuine spiritual understanding.

questions.question: Based on 1 Corinthians 8, what should a believer do if their freedom causes another believer to sin?
options: Restrict their freedom to avoid causing sin
Continue freely without concern
Encourage the other to be stronger
Ignore the situation
questions.correctAnswer: Restrict their freedom to avoid causing sin
questions.explanation: Verse 13 teaches that if exercising freedom causes a brother to offend, the believer should willingly limit themselves out of love and concern for the brother’s spiritual health.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8 say about the role of Jesus Christ in creation and believers' lives?
options: All things are by Him, and we live through Him
He is just a teacher
He created only a part of the world
He is one of many lords
questions.correctAnswer: All things are by Him, and we live through Him
questions.explanation: Verse 6 teaches that Jesus Christ is the Lord through whom all things were made and in whom believers live, highlighting His divine role in creation and salvation.

hard.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Corinthians Chapter 8.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 8, what contrast is made between knowledge and love (charity)?
options: Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth
Love puffeth up, but knowledge edifieth
Knowledge and charity both edify
Charity puffeth up, but knowledge edifieth
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:1 contrasts knowledge, which can cause pride, with charity (love), which builds up others.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:4, what is the theological significance of eating food offered to idols?
options: An idol is nothing in the world, and there is none other God but one
Eating such food is an act of worship to false gods
Food offered to idols is unclean and forbidden
Eating food offered to idols causes spiritual defilement
questions.correctAnswer: An idol is nothing in the world, and there is none other God but one
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes the monotheistic belief that idols have no real existence, affirming one God only.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 8:6 describe the relationship between God the Father and Jesus Christ?
options: One God, the Father, and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things
The Father and Jesus Christ are two separate gods
Jesus Christ is subordinate and separate from God the Father
God the Father and Jesus Christ are interchangeable names
questions.correctAnswer: One God, the Father, and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things
questions.explanation: This verse affirms monotheism with a distinction between the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ as central to creation and existence.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'conscience being weak' in 1 Corinthians 8:7?
options: Some eat food offered to idols and feel guilty because of their conscience
Their conscience is strong and confident in knowledge
They have no moral concerns about idol food
They deliberately disobey God's law
questions.correctAnswer: Some eat food offered to idols and feel guilty because of their conscience
questions.explanation: The 'weak conscience' refers to believers who are sensitive to idolatry and are troubled by eating such food.

questions.question: What warning does Paul give in 1 Corinthians 8:9 about Christian liberty?
options: Do not let your liberty become a stumblingblock to the weak
Use your liberty without concern for others
Liberty should be exercised openly in idol temples
Freedom in Christ means no restrictions at all
questions.correctAnswer: Do not let your liberty become a stumblingblock to the weak
questions.explanation: Paul cautions believers that exercising their freedom might cause weaker brethren to stumble in faith.

questions.question: In the context of 1 Corinthians 8, what does it mean that 'knowledge puffeth up' (v.1)?
options: Knowledge can lead to pride and arrogance
Knowledge is the source of true humility
Knowledge is irrelevant to Christian life
Knowledge always leads to love
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge can lead to pride and arrogance
questions.explanation: The phrase indicates that knowledge alone can cause a person to become conceited if not tempered by love.

questions.question: What theological implication does 1 Corinthians 8:5 make about 'gods many, and lords many'?
options: There are many so-called gods and lords, but only one true God
There are multiple gods to be worshiped
The gods in heaven and earth are equal to the one true God
The term 'gods' refers only to human rulers
questions.correctAnswer: There are many so-called gods and lords, but only one true God
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges the existence of many named gods in culture but asserts monotheism as foundational.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 8:8, eating meat offered to idols makes a person spiritually better before God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The verse states that eating or not eating meat offered to idols does not commend us to God or make us better or worse.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 8:11 emphasize the seriousness of causing a weaker brother to stumble?
options: The weak brother may perish for whom Christ died
It is a minor offense with no eternal consequence
Only the strong brothers are accountable
Stumbling is expected and unavoidable
questions.correctAnswer: The weak brother may perish for whom Christ died
questions.explanation: Paul highlights that causing a believer to fall harms someone dearly valued by Christ, underscoring moral responsibility.

questions.question: What kind of sin is described in 1 Corinthians 8:12 in relation to wounding a weak brother’s conscience?
options: Sinning against the brethren and Christ
A sin only against oneself
A sin against the law of Moses
Not considered a sin
questions.correctAnswer: Sinning against the brethren and Christ
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that harming a fellow believer's conscience is equivalent to sinning against Christ Himself.

questions.question: What decision does Paul express in 1 Corinthians 8:13 regarding eating meat that causes a brother to offend?
options: He will eat no flesh while the world stands to avoid causing offense
He will eat freely and disregard others’ conscience
He will only eat meat offered to idols
He will encourage others to eat regardless
questions.correctAnswer: He will eat no flesh while the world stands to avoid causing offense
questions.explanation: Paul demonstrates self-sacrifice prioritizing the spiritual welfare of others over personal liberty.

questions.question: Which Greek word translated as 'charity' in 1 Corinthians 8:1 has broader meanings including love and benevolence?
options: Agape
Philia
Eros
Storge
questions.correctAnswer: Agape
questions.explanation: The Greek term 'agape' denotes selfless, unconditional love which edifies others, as used in this chapter.

questions.question: How does the teaching in 1 Corinthians 8 relate to the Old Testament prohibition against idolatry (e.g., Exodus 20:3)?
options: It reaffirms exclusive worship of the one true God despite cultural idol practices
It permits participation in idol worship under certain conditions
It denies any spiritual harm from idols
It ignores the Old Testament law
questions.correctAnswer: It reaffirms exclusive worship of the one true God despite cultural idol practices
questions.explanation: Paul’s teaching echoes the Old Testament command to reject idols, emphasizing monotheism and love over legalism.

questions.question: What literary device is used in the structure of 1 Corinthians 8:1-3, contrasting knowledge and love?
options: Antithesis
Chiasm
Metaphor
Simile
questions.correctAnswer: Antithesis
questions.explanation: The passage uses antithesis by juxtaposing knowledge and love to highlight their differing effects.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 8, Paul’s primary concern is knowledge rather than love when dealing with food offered to idols.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Paul prioritizes love and concern for the conscience of others over mere knowledge about idol food.

theological.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Corinthians Chapter 8 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:1, what is the relationship between knowledge and charity?
options: Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth
Charity puffeth up, but knowledge edifieth
Both knowledge and charity puff up
Neither knowledge nor charity edify
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 8:1 teaches that knowledge can lead to pride, whereas charity (love) builds up others. This is consistent with Proverbs 16:18 warning against pride, and 1 Corinthians 13:1-3 emphasizing love as supreme. Ephesians 4:15 also encourages speaking the truth in love.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8:2 say about a person who thinks they know something?
options: They know nothing yet as they ought to know
They are wise and knowledgeable
They have perfect understanding
Their knowledge is complete
questions.correctAnswer: They know nothing yet as they ought to know
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes humility in knowledge, echoing Proverbs 3:5-7 that warns against leaning on one's own understanding, and James 1:5 which encourages seeking wisdom from God. The statement aligns with the biblical theme that human knowledge is limited.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:3, how is a person who loves God recognized?
options: The same is known of him
They receive miraculous signs
They never sin
They speak in tongues
questions.correctAnswer: The same is known of him
questions.explanation: This verse asserts that God knows those who love Him, reflecting Psalm 1:6 and John 10:14-15 where Jesus speaks of knowing His sheep. It highlights God's omniscience and intimate knowledge of believers.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8:4 teach about idols and God?
options: An idol is nothing in the world, and there is none other God but one
Idols have power equal to God
There are many gods with equal authority
Idols should be worshipped alongside God
questions.correctAnswer: An idol is nothing in the world, and there is none other God but one
questions.explanation: This affirms monotheism, consistent with Deuteronomy 6:4's Shema, and Isaiah 45:5 declaring God as the only God. It discredits idolatry as powerless, aligning with Psalms 115:4-8 which contrasts idols to the living God.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 8:6 describe the relationship between God the Father and Jesus Christ?
options: One God, the Father, and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things
Two gods working independently
Jesus is less than the Father
They are the same person
questions.correctAnswer: One God, the Father, and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things
questions.explanation: This verse distinguishes the Father as God and Jesus as Lord, affirming the unique roles within the Godhead, consistent with John 1:3 and Colossians 1:16. It supports orthodox Trinitarian doctrine without confusion of persons.

questions.question: What problem does 1 Corinthians 8:7 highlight regarding knowledge about idols?
options: Not everyone has this knowledge; some with a weak conscience eat food offered to idols
Everyone fully understands idols are nothing
Knowledge of idols always leads to sin
Idols have real power over some people
questions.correctAnswer: Not everyone has this knowledge; some with a weak conscience eat food offered to idols
questions.explanation: This verse acknowledges varying levels of understanding among believers, reflecting Romans 14:1-3 about accepting weaker brethren and their conscience. It warns against despising those with less knowledge.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:8, what is the effect of eating meat offered to idols on our relationship with God?
options: Neither eating nor not eating makes us better or worse to God
Eating meat offered to idols makes us holy
Not eating meat offered to idols makes us sinners
Eating meat offered to idols breaks our fellowship with God
questions.correctAnswer: Neither eating nor not eating makes us better or worse to God
questions.explanation: This communicates that food itself is morally neutral (cf. Romans 14:14), and that God judges the heart rather than dietary choices. It aligns with Jesus' teaching in Mark 7:18-19 about purity and defilement.

questions.question: What warning is given in 1 Corinthians 8:9 about Christian liberty?
options: Do not let your liberty become a stumblingblock to the weak
Liberty should be exercised without concern for others
Christian liberty means all things are permissible without restriction
Liberty is more important than conscience
questions.correctAnswer: Do not let your liberty become a stumblingblock to the weak
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes love and responsibility over rights, echoing Romans 14:13 and Galatians 5:13 about not using freedom to harm others. It teaches that Christian liberty must be limited by concern for weaker believers.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 8:11, what consequence is described for the 'weak brother' due to another's knowledge?
options: The weak brother perishes, for whom Christ died
The weak brother becomes stronger in faith
The weak brother is indifferent to idols
The weak brother gains knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: The weak brother perishes, for whom Christ died
questions.explanation: This verse highlights the seriousness of causing spiritual harm, consistent with Matthew 18:6's warning about leading others to sin and Hebrews 6:4-6 about apostasy. It stresses the value of each believer to Christ.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 8:12, sinning against the brethren by wounding their conscience is equivalent to sinning against whom?
options: Christ
The Holy Spirit
The church leaders
The synagogue
questions.correctAnswer: Christ
questions.explanation: The verse equates offense against fellow believers to offense against Christ, aligning with Jesus' teaching in Matthew 25:40 where serving others is serving Him. It underscores the unity of the body of Christ (Ephesians 4:25).

questions.question: What personal resolution does Paul make in 1 Corinthians 8:13 concerning eating meat?
options: If meat makes my brother offend, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth
I will eat all meat regardless of others
I will never eat meat again
I will only eat meat offered to idols
questions.correctAnswer: If meat makes my brother offend, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth
questions.explanation: Paul prioritizes love and the edification of others above his liberty, reflecting Romans 15:1-2 about pleasing others for their good. This attitude shows sacrificial love as taught in Philippians 2:3-4.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8:5 indicate about the existence of 'gods' in heaven or earth?
options: There are many gods and lords called gods
There is only one true God and no others
God is unaware of other gods
The gods are more powerful than the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: There are many gods and lords called gods
questions.explanation: This acknowledges the belief in multiple gods in the world (cf. Psalm 82:1), but as 1 Corinthians 8:6 clarifies, only one is true God. This distinction is important for apologetics against polytheism.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8:10 say might happen if a knowledgeable Christian eats in an idol's temple?
options: The conscience of the weak is emboldened to eat things offered to idols
Everyone will gain deeper faith
The temple is cleansed by their presence
The idol god becomes angry
questions.correctAnswer: The conscience of the weak is emboldened to eat things offered to idols
questions.explanation: This verse warns that the actions of mature believers can influence weaker believers negatively, echoing Romans 14:21 about not causing others to stumble. It teaches responsible freedom.

questions.question: What is the ultimate source of all things according to 1 Corinthians 8:6?
options: The Father, from whom are all things, and the Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things
The gods many, both in heaven and earth
Idols and earthly powers
Human knowledge and wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: The Father, from whom are all things, and the Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things
questions.explanation: This establishes God the Father as the origin and Jesus Christ as the agent of creation, consistent with Genesis 1:1, John 1:3, and Colossians 1:16. It affirms divine sovereignty and Christ's role in creation.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 8:9 caution against in the exercise of Christian freedom?
options: Taking heed lest liberty becomes a stumblingblock to the weak
Exercising liberty without limits
Ignoring the conscience of others
Promoting legalism
questions.correctAnswer: Taking heed lest liberty becomes a stumblingblock to the weak
questions.explanation: This repeats the theme of responsible freedom, urging believers to consider others' consciences. It is consistent with Galatians 5:13-15 and Romans 14:15 which warn against causing others to sin through liberty.
